channel.title: CSIS — Analysis (custom RSS)
channel.description: Auto-generated RSS feed for CSIS Analysis pages.

item.title: Will the Tomahawks Save Ukraine?
item.description: About a thousand Tomahawk missiles in the U.S. stockpile today are available for transfer to Ukraine. They could have a major impact on the war, but the Pacific theater needs and Russian opposition could disrupt any deal.

item.title: What Could a Trump Peace Plan in Ukraine Look Like?
item.description: As Trump’s team pushes for a Ukraine peace deal amid new pressure on Russia, experts and AI models outline the most likely outcomes, from frozen frontlines to the economic and security terms shaping negotiations.

item.title: Caribbean Update: Fifth Suspected Drug Runner Destroyed
item.description: U.S. attacks on suspected drug boats have become routine. They will likely continue until the administration decides to return the counterdrug mission to law enforcement agencies or a tragic incident heightens domestic and regional opposition to U.S. operations.

item.title: In Memoriam: Debbie Stroman
item.description: CSIS President and CEO John Hamre issued a statement on the passing of CSIS Human Resources Special Assistant Deborah D. Stroman.

item.title: What to Expect from the Trump-Albanese White House Meeting
item.description: When Anthony Albanese meets Donald Trump at the White House on Monday, the stakes will be high for the U.S.-Australia alliance as tariffs, AUKUS, and critical minerals top the agenda.

item.title: Power Moves: How China’s Energy Investments Provide Durable Influence in South America
item.description: CSIS Americas Associate Fellow Henry Ziemer evaluates China's investments in energy generation and distribution infrastructure in South America.

item.title: Book Launch—The Formula for Better Health: How to Save Millions of Lives—Including Your Own
item.description: Author Tom Frieden joined Julie Gerberding for the book launch of The Formula for Better Health: How to Save Millions of Lives—Including Your Own.

item.title: States Weekly: October 15, 2025
item.description: This edition of States Weekly covers October 15, 2025.

item.title: Seth Jones and Tom Karako in WSJ: A Step Toward Peace: ‘I’m Going to Send Them Tomahawks’
item.description: “As with Hamas in Gaza, ending the Ukraine war will require speaking Moscow’s language: force,” write CSIS Defense and Security Department experts Seth G. Jones and Tom Karako.
